_prev_prog_3.Description:
Process Safety Information (68.65) - The process capacity is 60,000 lbs. of ammonia.  The MSDS is available to all employees associated with the process.  The process is not only designed in compliance with good engineering practices and with federal and state regulations, but it is also maintained with safe operating ranges.
                                                                                                                               Process Hazard Analysis (68.67) - The process hazard analysis (PHA) for Chattem Chemical's Inc. Chattanooga, TN facility indicates that the facility was properly designed and is following procedures which minimize the probability of a release.  The elements of the PHA include those hazards associated with the chemicals use, equipment malfunctions, human errors that may result in an accidental release, safeguards to prevent accidental releases, and detection and monitoring steps.  The PHA is performed by qualified personnel knowledgeable in the process and in the PHA methodology.

Operating Procedures (68.69) - The process is operated by trained personnel using safe operating practices.  Specifically, there are written operating procedures for each operating phase including initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown, startup, correction of deviations and equipment inspections.  These written operating procedures are regularly reviewed and are readily accessible to the operators.

Training (68.71) - All employees presently operating or assigned to the process have been trained or tested in the skills and duties necessary to safely operate the process.  Furthermore, all employees who are newly assigned to the process are thoroughly trained and tested proficient before operating the process.  A list of the trained employees is maintained.   Refresher training is provided at least every three years, or more frequently if needed to maintain safe operating practices.

Mechanical Integrity (68.73) - All process equipment is properly inspected and serviced either by trained employees or maintenance contractors.  Any maintenance contractor shall ensure that each contract employee is properly trained in the maintenance procedures to be performed.  All identified equipment deficiencies are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Management of Change (68.75) - Written procedures are in place to manage process changes, including changes in equipment and procedures.  All personnel affected by these changes are promptly informed of the changes and trained to deal with the modification.

Pre-Startup Review (68.77) - Whenever a change is made to the process necessitating a change in the safety information, Chattem Chemicals, Inc. confirms the completeness of the Prevention Program revision.  This includes confirming that a PHA has been performed for the correctly installed equipment, procedures are in place for operations, maintenance, and emergency response, and the employees trained in the new procedures.

Compliance Audits (68.79) - The procedures and practices of the RMP Prevention Program for the process at Chattem Chemicals, Inc. Chattanooga, TN facility comply with the requirements of 40 CFR 68 and are currently being followed.  Compliance audits are conducted at least every three years to determine if current procedures are appropriate and being followed.  The most recent compliance audits are available for review.

Incident Investigations (68.81) - All incidents which resulted in or may have resulted in a catastrophic release are investigated in order to correct safety deficiencies that have the potential to result in a future release.  Investigations begin less than 24 hours after the occurrence of the incident.  The findings of the investigation are reviewed with all affected personnel and corrective action is taken to prevent future releases.  The summaries of all of the incident investigations from the past five years are available.

Employee Participation (68.83) - Chattem Chemicals, Inc. employees have participated in the development of the PHA, operating and maintenance procedures.  All employees are made aware of the hazards associated with the process, as well as the effort to assess and minimize the probability and effect of a release.

Hot Work Permit (68.85) - Chattem Chemicals, Inc. has in place procedures to safely conduct hot work.  These include procedures for initiation, hot work area review, safe hot work methods, and fire watches.

Contractors (68.87) - In order to minimize the risk associated with the use of contractors on the process, Chattem Chemicals, Inc. reviews the safety history of each potential contractor.  All contractors working on the process are informed of the process hazards and emergency procedures.  Procedures are in place to limit and control contractor movement on site.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Chattem Chemicals, Inc. stores and uses ammonia on site at the Chattanooga, Tennessee facility as a chemical feedstock in quantities that exceed the threshold quantity for ammonia as defined by the Risk Management Program (RMP) regulations.  Chattem Chemicals, Inc. has developed and implemented a accidental release prevention program under the RMP program that addresses the hazards associated with the process and implements procedures which minimize the possibility and severity of an ammonia release.



Chattem Chemicals has not had an ammonia accident in the fifteen years the RMP program has been in effect that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.  An OSHA Process Safety Management Program is currently maintained for the ammonia process in conjunction with the RMP program.  



Our worst-case scenario is the unlikely failure of the ammonia storage tank during a time in which the maximum amount of ammonia is stored in it.  The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and public receptors are within distance of the endpoint.  Our alternative release scenario is a pipe leak.  The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint.



In the event of an emergency involving the ammonia process, it is our policy to notify the Chattanooga Fire Department and the Hamilton County LEPC.  There are no planned safety changes to the process at the current time.
